com.here.sdk.mapviewlite

Class CameraLimits

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.NativeBase
      • com.here.sdk.mapviewlite.CameraLimits

  • public final class CameraLimits
extends NativeBase

    Controls constraints on camera parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxTilt

        public double getMaxTilt()

        Gets current maximum allowed tilt angle. This value is always larger than or equal to the minimum tilt angle. The value of the maximum allowed tilt angle depends on current zoom level.

        Returns:

        New maximum allowed tilt angle, in degrees from the nadir direction at the target point.

      • getMaxTiltForZoomLevel

        public static double getMaxTiltForZoomLevel(double zoomLevel)

        Get maximum allowed tilt angle for specific zoom level. This value is always larger than or equal to the minimum tilt angle.

        Parameters:
        zoomLevel -

        The zoom level for which we want to check maximum tilt limit.

        Returns:

        Maximum allowed tilt angle, in degrees from the nadir direction, for specified zoom level.

      • getMinTilt

        public double getMinTilt()

        Gets current minimum allowed tilt angle. This value is always less than or equal to the maximum tilt angle. By default, the value returned is CameraLimits.MIN_TILT. Otherwise, if a new value is set with CameraLimits.setMinTilt(double), then this will be returned.

        Returns:

        New minimum allowed tilt angle, in degrees from the nadir direction at the target point.

      • setMaxTilt

        public void setMaxTilt(double degreesFromNadir)
                throws CameraLimits.CameraLimitsException

        Sets maximum tilt angle that can be set on the camera. If current camera tilt is larger then this value, it will immediately be changed to the maximum set here. This method will fail if the value being set is smaller than minimum set tilt, smaller than absolute minimum value allowed or larger than absolute maximum value allowed.

        Parameters:
        degreesFromNadir -

        Maximum tilt angle, in degrees from the nadir direction at the target point.

        Throws:
        CameraLimits.CameraLimitsException

      • setMinTilt

        public void setMinTilt(double degreesFromNadir)
                throws CameraLimits.CameraLimitsException

        Sets minimum tilt angle that can be set on the camera. If current camera tilt is smaller then this value, it will immediately be changed to the minimum set here. This method will fail if the value being set is larger than maximum set tilt, smaller than absolute minimum value allowed or larger than absolute maximum value allowed.

        Parameters:
        degreesFromNadir -

        Minimum tilt angle, in degrees from the nadir direction at the target point.

        Throws:
        CameraLimits.CameraLimitsException

      • getMaxZoomLevel

        public double getMaxZoomLevel()

        Gets current maximum allowed zoom level. This value is always larger than or equal to the minimum zoom level. By default, the value returned is CameraLimits.MAX_ZOOM_LEVEL. Otherwise, if a new value is set with CameraLimits.setMaxZoomLevel(double), then this will be returned.

        Returns:

        New maximum allowed zoom level.

      • getMinZoomLevel

        public double getMinZoomLevel()

        Gets current minimum allowed zoom level. This value is always less than or equal to the maximum zoom level. By default, the value returned is CameraLimits.MIN_ZOOM_LEVEL. Otherwise, if a new value is set with CameraLimits.setMinZoomLevel(double), then this will be returned.

        Returns:

        New minimum allowed zoom level.

      • setMaxZoomLevel

        public void setMaxZoomLevel(double zoomLevel)
                     throws CameraLimits.CameraLimitsException

        Sets maximum zoom level that can be set on the camera. If current camera zoom level is larger then this value, it will immediately be changed to the maximum set here. This method will fail if the value being set is smaller than minimum set zoom level, smaller than absolute minimum value allowed or larger than absolute maximum value allowed.

        Parameters:
        zoomLevel -

        The zoom level to set as maximum allowed value.

        Throws:
        CameraLimits.CameraLimitsException

      • setMinZoomLevel

        public void setMinZoomLevel(double zoomLevel)
                     throws CameraLimits.CameraLimitsException

        Sets minimum zoom level that can be set on the camera. If current camera zoom level is smaller then this value, it will immediately be changed to the minimum set here. This method will fail if the value being set is larger than maximum set zoom level, smaller than absolute minimum value allowed or larger than absolute maximum value allowed.

        Parameters:
        zoomLevel -

        The zoom level to set as minimum allowed value.

        Throws:
        CameraLimits.CameraLimitsException

      • getBearingRange

        @NonNull
public AngleRange getBearingRange()

        Get the range set currently. This may not be active now if no rendering loop has been executed since the last call to set the range.

      • setBearingRange

        public void setBearingRange(@NonNull
                            AngleRange value)

        Set a new range. It will be updated during the next rendering loop.

        Parameters:
        value -

        The bearing range within which to rotate the camera. If the current camera bearing exceeds the limit range, it will immediately be set to minimum or maximum, depending on which is closest. If distances are equal a limit closest in clockwise direction is returned. By default, a full circle is set during initialization.

      • getTargetArea

        @Nullable
public GeoBox getTargetArea()

        Gets a GeoBox that limits the camera target to a specific geographical area. Absence of a value means that there is no limit.

      • setTargetArea

        public void setTargetArea(@Nullable
                          GeoBox value)

        Sets a GeoBox that limits the camera target to a specific geographical area.

        Parameters:
        value -

        Limits the camera target to a specific geographical area. Absence of a value means that there is no limit.
